title.text: Named Entity Extraction with Conditional Markov Models and Classifiers

introductionContent.text: Our approach to multilingual named entity (NE) recognition in the context of the CoNLL Shared Task consists of the following ingredients: Feature engineering A human expert (though not necessarily a language expert) determines relevant features to be used to determine whether or not a word is part of a named entity.
Extraction Ina first phase a conditional Markov model extracts candidate NE phrases, but does not classify them yet into LOC, ORG, etc.

tableCaptions.text: Table 1: Extraction results obtained for the devel- opment data sets for the two languages used in this  shared task.
Table 2: Classification results obtained for the de- velopment data sets for the two languages used in  this shared task.
